work.company: Mann-Grandstaff VA Medical Center Behavioral Health Services (BHS) and Healthcare for Homeless Veterans (HCHV), Clinical Mental Health Counseling Intern
work.summary: I was one of the 18 interns nationwide (at seven VA Medical Centers; including Canandaigua NY, Houston TX, Spokane WA, Cleveland OH, Syracuse NY, Bay Pines and Tampa, FL) to be accepted into The Department of Veterans Affairs’ (VA) new program which included clinical training opportunities to LPMHC students with clinical experiences within VA’s interprofessional mental health teams. This included physicians, psychologists, social workers, nurses, and other mental health professionals working collaboratively to provide patient care. This initiative was intended to attract and encourage Licensed Professional Mental Health Counselors (LPMHC) to choose VA for employment as part of the VA’s recruitment plan to hire additional mental health care professionals to serve our Veterans.
highlights: I am the first in the nation to graduate from this program. *Please note this is stipend paid internship wherein I am operating at a GS-9 capacity
Shared my time between BHS and HCHV locations

Provided individual, family, couples and group therapy using evidence based practices; both in-office and in community outreach/ in Veteran’s homes (primarily under the HUD-VASH program). Group work included Transgender Support, Couples PTSD Symptom Management, Finding Solutions for Suicide
Performed weekly intakes; full mental health assessments including diagnosis and service recommendations for incoming Veterans
Participated in the VA’s only men’s facilitated peer support group for Finding Solutions (promoting zero suicide) in the nation, and advocated for the implementation of this group for female Veterans
Assisted Veterans obtain vocational goals, and made referrals for services including peer support, substance abuse support, inpatient services, and with pursuing educational
Participation on multidisciplinary Home Team meetings
Collaboration with community partners including Goodwill Industries, Frontier Behavioral Health, the Veteran’s Center, CHOICE partners, Food Banks, homeless shelters, group homes, and area hospitals
Utilized Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS) to provide accurate and timely clinical charting and treatment planning to ensure continuity of care and made appropriate referrals when necessary

Utilized technologies including VistA Visual Aid, VistAWeb, CPRS, CPRS Remote Data View, Joint Legacy Viewer (JLV), VA Time and Attendance System (VATAS), Mental Health Suite, Citrix and VA Talent Management System (TMS

work.summary: A nonprofit Trauma-Informed Care organization which strives to ensure that individuals of all ages have timely access to mental health services and is the Lead Service Provider in the Regional Support Network.
Completed my Practicum promoting independence and enhanced quality of life for home-dwelling older adults, especially those who are at-risk and isolated.
highlights: Provided individual and group therapy using evidence based practices. Group work included Geriatric Men's Support and Elders' Caregiver Support
Community outreach and in-home interdisciplinary clinical case and care management
Assisted clients in developing necessary skills to improve  quality of life and stability in the community
Connected individuals with necessary supports and resources
Direct interdisciplinary cooperation with Psychiatric Services for medication management
Collaboration with community partners including COPES and Adult Protective Services
Caregiver support including Respite and Kinship Care

work.summary: Completed my Summer Internship serving individuals diagnosed with a severe and persistent mental illnesses with complex needs, in office and in their own home, group home or residential facility.
highlights: Provided individual, family, couples, group and co occurring therapy using evidence based practices both in-office and through community outreach. Group work included Women's Anxiety, Substance Abuse Psycho-education, Substance Abuse Support, Anphetamine Recovery, and Art Therapy

Offered education regarding specific disorder and symptom management and assisted clients in developing necessary skills to improve  quality of life and stability in the community, pursuing educational and vocational goals, and connected individuals with necessary supports and resources
Direct interdisciplinary cooperation with Psychiatry and Primary Care Physicians for medication management and promoting good health
Worked directly with the Crisis Response Team and the Hospital Diversion Team
Worked directly with peer support services for smooth transition from long term psychiatric hospitalization/incarceration to independent living
Collaboration with community partners including Division of Child and Family Services, Child Protective Services (CPS), Police Department, State Psychiatric Hospital,  foster families, schools

Utilized ERMA and Relias technologies to provide accurate and timely clinical charting and to ensure continuity of care and designed treatment plans, using SMART Goal guidelines, that utilized client strengths to achieve their life goals

work.summary: As Office Manager, I promoted a warm inclusive work environment while maintaining emphasis on improving health through preventative and restorative care.
highlights: Oversaw staff;  hired, trained, mentored, and performed timely performance reviews; secured and maintained professional credentialing, continuing education requirements, and professional  licensure and insurance.
Oversaw facility operations; performed daily reconciliations along with scheduled projections, lien processing, insurance coordination, recalls, billing, collections, and accounts payable/receivable.

work.summary: As Owner/Operator, I was dedicated to providing exceptional cleaning services for families and professionals alike through valuing our reputation for excellence and customer satisfaction by maintaining focus on our mission of treating each home or office as if it were our own.

As Front Office Coordinator I oversaw the process of creating signature Memory Keepsake Tribute Videos that provide comfort, celebrate life and preserve memories through craftsmanship, expertise and compassion.
highlights: Implemented new productivity software
Managed multi-line phone system, prepared vendor orders, purchasing, shipping and receiving, as well as managing the marketing supplies, manuals, and software.

work.summary: As Business Manager, I was committed to the support and growth of my professional team by promoting clinical excellence through continuing education, interdisciplinary teamwork, and community outreach.
highlights: Supervised staff, ran staff meetings, performed record keeping audits, daily reconciliations, scheduled projections, accounts payable/receivable, coordinated insurance and counseled families on their treatment options and financial responsibilities.

work.summary: As Owner/Operator, I welcomed children of all abilities, with the commitment to provide quality care, and opportunity for development and learning with a focus on diversity in an atmosphere which fostered a sense of love and belonging.
As office manager I coordinated insurance, scheduling, billing, marketing, amputee support functions, and performed light fittings.
highlights: Implemented modernized recordkeeping systems
Improved productivity via implementation of GEMBA standards.

work.summary: As office manager, I carried out our mission of providing dental care excellence through Gentle Dentistry where we implemented a holistic approach in which dental care was treated as a critical part of one's health.
highlights: Oversaw staff, production, scheduling, and billing, created financial reports and projections, and counseled patients on treatment options and financial responsibilities.

volunteer.summary: Implemented and participated in fundraisers, adoption drives, community outreach programs, assisted in adoptions, marketing, foster program, barn cat program, and stray programs. Honored to serve on the "A" Team, which is a special training unit that works to train dogs who would otherwise be euthanized.

Educator in the Newcomer's Center for incoming refugee students; preparing students to integrate into the American High School setting. Participated in the after school homework lab which was inclusive for all ELL students.
Prepared, served, and ate meals with the homeless patrons.
Master Diver, Rescue Diver, Diver Training, Dive Lead
